description: The connector spec file tells ISC how the connector should interact between ISC and the custom connector. It is the glue between ISC and the connector, so understanding the different sections are key to understanding how to build a custom connectors.

name.description: The name of the connector as it appears in ISC. Tags can be appended to this name.

keyType.description: This determines which type of key your connector expects to receive and send back for each of the commands

commands.description: The list of commands the connector supports

sourceConfigInitialValues.description: Key value pair of source config item keys and the default value that should be associated with them.

sourceConfig.description: A list of configuration items you must provide when you create a source in ISC. The order of these items is preserved in the UI.

type.description: It indicates a new menu for the sidebar. You can have multiple sections defined for complex connector configurations

label.description: This label indicates the text that will show up on the sidebar in ISC

type.description: It indicates a new section on the page

sectionTitle.description: The large text title that will display for the section.

sectionHelpMessage.description: A description about the section that can help the user understand what it is used for and how to fill out the fields
examples: Provide the parameters to connect with the airtable worksheet.

docLinkLabel.description: An optional field that is the text that displays next to documentation help link.

docLink.description: The optional link that the docLinkLabel will direct to if clicked.

items.description: The array of input fields for the menu item

key.description: The name of the configuration item as it is referenced in code.

label.description: The name of the configuration item as it appears in the UI.

required.description: You must populate required configuration items in the ISC source configuration wizard before continuing.

examples: Add a list of entitlements to expose via your source

accountSchema.description: The schema for an account in ISC populated by data from the source.

displayAttribute.description: Identifies the attribute (defined below) used to map to Account Name in the Identity Security Cloud account schema. This should be a unique value even though it is not required because the connector will use this value to correlate accounts in ISC to accounts in the source system.
displayAttribute.markdownDescription: Identifies the attribute (defined below) used to map to `Account Name` in the Identity Security Cloud account schema. This should be a unique value even though it is not required because the connector will use this value to correlate accounts in ISC to accounts in the source system.

identityAttribute.description: Identifies the attribute (defined below) used to map to Account ID in the Identity Security Cloud account schema. This must be a globally unique identifier, such as email address, employee ID, etc.
identityAttribute.markdownDescription: Identifies the attribute (defined below) used to map to `Account ID` in the Identity Security Cloud account schema. This must be a globally unique identifier, such as email address, employee ID, etc.

groupAttribute.description: Identifies the attribute used to map accounts to entitlements. For example, a web service can define groups that users are members of, and the groups grant entitlements to each user. In this case, groupAttribute is “groups”, and there is also an account attribute called “groups”.
groupAttribute.markdownDescription: Identifies the attribute used to map accounts to entitlements. For example, a web service can define `groups` that users are members of, and the `groups` grant entitlements to each user. In this case, **groupAttribute** is “groups”, and there is also an account attribute called “groups”.

attributes.description: One or more attributes that map to a user’s attribute on the target source.

name.description: The attribute's name as it appears in ISC.

description.description: A helpful description of the attribute. This is useful to source owners when they are trying to understand the account schema.

entitlement.title: The boolean indicates whether the attribute is an entitlement.
entitlement.description: This boolean indicates whether the attribute is an entitlement. Entitlements give identities privileges on the source system. Use this indication to determine which fields to synchronize with accounts in ISC for tasks such as separation of duties and role assignment.

managed.description: This indicates whether the entitlements are manageable through ISC or read-only.

multi.description: This indicates entitlements that are stored in an array format. This one field can store multiple entitlements for a single account.

defaultSnippets.label: attribute
defaultSnippets.description: Add new attribute to the schema

defaultSnippets.label: entitlement
defaultSnippets.description: Add new entitlement to the schema

entitlementSchemas.description: A list of entitlement schemas in ISC populated by data from the source.

type.description: The entitlement's type. Currently, only group is supported.
type.markdownDescription: The entitlement's type. Currently, only `group` is supported.

displayAttribute.description: The entitlement attribute's name. This can be the name or another human friendly identifier for a group.
displayAttribute.markdownDescription: The entitlement attribute's name. This can be the `name` or another human friendly identifier for a group.

identityAttribute.description: The entitlement attribute's unique ID. This can be the id or another unique key for a group.
identityAttribute.markdownDescription: The entitlement attribute's unique ID. This can be the `id` or another unique key for a group.

name.description: The name of the attribute as it appears in ISC.

description.title: A helpful description the attribute.
examples: Unique ID of the group (ex. admin)
The display name of the group (ex. Admin)

defaultSnippets.label: attribute
defaultSnippets.description: Add new attribute to the schema

accountCreateTemplate.description: A map of identity attributes ISC will pass to the connector to create an account in the target source.

key.description: The unique identifier of the attribute. This is also the name that is presented in the Create Profile screen in ISC.

label.description: A friendly name for presentation purposes.

required.description: Determines whether the account create operation requires this attribute. It defaults to false. If it is true and Identity Security Cloud encounters an identity missing this attribute, ISC does not send the account to the connector for account creation.
required.markdownDescription: Determines whether the account create operation requires this attribute. It defaults to `false`. If it is `true` and Identity Security Cloud encounters an identity missing this attribute, ISC does not send the account to the connector for account creation.

initialValue.description: Use this to specify identitAttribute mapping, generator or default values.

attributes.description: Attributes change depending on the type selected

name.description: Use this to identify the mapping for identityAttribute type, or the generator to use (Create Password, Create Unique Account ID).
name.markdownDescription: Use this to identify the mapping for identityAttribute type, or the generator to use (`Create Password`, `Create Unique Account ID`).

value.description: Use this as the default value for the static type.
value.markdownDescription: Use this to identify the mapping for identityAttribute type, or the generator to use (`Create Password`, `Create Unique Account ID`).

maxSize.description: Use this for the Create Unique Account ID generator type. This value specifies the maximum size of the username to be generated.

maxUniqueChecks.description: Use this for the Create Unique Account ID generator type. This value specifies the maximum retries in case a unique ID is not found with the first random generated user.

template.description: Use this for the Create Unique Account ID generator type. This value specifies the template used for generation. Example: "$(firstname).$(lastname)$(uniqueCounter)".
template.markdownDescription: Use this for the Create Unique Account ID generator type. This value specifies the template used for generation. Example: `$(firstname).$(lastname)$(uniqueCounter)`.
